article.paragraph: Alfonso Cuarn Orozco(IPA-esalˈfonso kwaˈɾon; born November 28, 1961) is a Mexicanfilm director,screenwriter,film producerproducerandFilm editoreditorbest known for his dramasA Little Princess (1995 film)A Little Princess(1995) andY Tu Mam Tambin(2001), the fantasy filmHarry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban(2004), and science fiction thrillersChildren of Men(2006) andGravity (film)Gravity(2013). Cuarn is the first Mexican director to win anAcademy Award for Best Directing.http://www.theguardian.com/film/2014/mar/03/alfonso-cuaron-wins-best-director-oscar

Most of his work has been praised by both audiences and critics, and has been nominated for sixAcademy AwardsincludingAcademy Award for Best Original ScreenplayBest Original ScreenplayforY Tu Mam Tambin, and bothAcademy Award for Best Adapted ScreenplayBest Adapted ScreenplayandAcademy Award for Best Film EditingBest Film EditingforChildren of Men. ForGravity, Cuarn received several major accolades for his achievement in direction, winning in the respective categories at the Academy Awards, theGolden Globe Award for Best DirectorGolden Globe Awards, theBAFTA Award for Best DirectionBAFTA Awardsand theDirectors Guild of America Award for Outstanding Directing Feature FilmDirectors Guild of America; and in addition winning the BAFTA AwardBAFTA Award for Best FilmBest British Filmand the Academy Award forAcademy Award for Best Film EditingBest Film Editing(shared withMark Sanger). He has also been awarded theBAFTA Award for Best FilmBAFTA Award for Best Film not in the English Languageas one of the producers ofPan's Labyrinth(2006). In his films, Cuarn is known for his ground-breaking use in the technique oflong takecontinuous uninterrupted shots.

Cuarn's brotherCarlos CuarnCarlos, as well as his sonJons CuarnJons, are also writers and directors and have both acted as co-writers in some of his works. He is also friends with fellow Mexican directorsGuillermo del ToroandAlejandro Gonzlez Irritu, collectively known as "The Three Amigos of Cinema."Citation neededMarch 2015
article.heading: Early life
article.paragraph: Alfonso Cuarn was born inMexico City, and is the son of Alfredo Cuarn, a nuclear physicist who worked for the United Nations'International Atomic Energy Agencyfor many years. He has two brothers,Carlos CuarnCarlos, also a filmmaker, and Alfredo, a conservation biologist.

Cuarn studied philosophy at theNational Autonomous University of Mexico(UNAM) and filmmaking at CUEC (Centro Universitario de Estudios Cinematogrficos), a school within the same university. There, he met the director Carlos Marcovich andcinematographerEmmanuel Lubezki, and they made what would be his firstshort film,Vengeance Is Mine.
article.heading: Career
article.paragraph: Cuarn began working in television in Mexico, first as a technician and then as a director. His television work led to assignments as an assistant director for several Latin American film productions includingGaby: A True StoryandRomero (film)Romero, and in 1991, he landed his first big-screen directorial assignment. On January 12, 2014, Alfonso accepted theGolden Globe Awardin the categoryGolden Globe Award for Best DirectorBest DirectorforGravity (film)Gravity(71st Golden Globe AwardsThe 71st Annual Golden Globe Awards, 2014). He also won two Oscars forAcademy Award for Best Film EditingBest Film EditingandAcademy Award for Best DirectingBest Directing.

Slo con tu parejawas a sex comedy about a womanizing businessman (played byDaniel Gimnez Cacho) who, after spurning an attractive nurse, is fooled into believing he's contractedAIDS. In addition to writing, producing and directing, Cuarn co-edited the film with Luis Patln. It is somewhat unusual for directors to be credited co-editors, although theCoen BrothersandRobert Rodriguezhave both directed and edited nearly all of their films. Cuarn continued this close involvement in editing on several of his later films.

The film, which also starred cabaret singerAstrid Hadadand model/actress Claudia Ramrez (with whom Cuarn was linked between 1989 and 1993), was a big hit in Mexico. After this success, directorSydney Pollackhired Cuarn to direct an episode ofFallen Angels (TV series)Fallen Angels, a series ofneo-noirstories produced for theShowtime (TV network)Showtimepremium cable network in 1993; other directors who worked on the series includedSteven Soderbergh,Jonathan Kaplan,Peter BogdanovichandTom Hanks.
article.heading: International success
article.paragraph: In 1995, Cuarn released his first feature film produced in the United States,A Little Princess (1995 film)A Little Princess, an adaptation ofFrances Hodgson Burnett's classic novel. Cuarn's next feature was also a literary adaptation, a modernized version ofCharles Dickens'sGreat Expectations (1998 film)Great ExpectationsstarringEthan Hawke,Gwyneth PaltrowandRobert De Niro.

Cuarn's next project found him returning to Mexico with a Spanish-speaking cast to filmY Tu Mam Tambin, starringGael Garca Bernal,Diego LunaandMaribel Verd. It was a provocative and controversial road comedy about two sexually obsessed teenagers who take an extended road trip with an attractive married woman that is much older than them. The film's open portrayal of sexuality and frequent rude humor, as well as the politically and socially relevant asides, made the film an international hit and a major success with critics. Cuarn shared anAcademy Awardnomination forAcademy Award for Best Writing (Original Screenplay)Best Original Screenplaywith co-writer and brotherCarlos Cuarn.

In 2003, Cuarn directed the third film in the successfulHarry Potter (film series)Harry Potterseries,Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban. Cuarn faced criticism from some of the more puristHarry Potterfans for his approach to the film. At the time of the movie's release, however, authorJ. K. Rowling, who had seen and loved Cuarn's filmY Tu Mam Tambin, said that it was her personal favorite from the series so far.J.K. RowlingAccessed January 17, 2007.Critically, the film was also better received than the first two installments, with some critics remarking that it was the firstHarry Potterfilm to truly capture the essence of the novels.RT: Prisoner of AzkabanIt remained as the most critically acclaimed film of theHarry Potterfilm franchise until the release ofHarry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2.

Cuarn's featureChildren of Men, an adaptation of theP. D. Jamesnovel starringClive Owen,Julianne MooreandMichael Caine, received wide critical acclaim, including threeAcademy Awardnominations. Cuarn himself received two nominations for his work on the film inAcademy Award for Best Film EditingBest Film Editing(withAlex Rodrguez (film editor)Alex Rodrguez) andAcademy Award for Best Adapted ScreenplayBest Adapted Screenplay(with several collaborators).

He created the production and distribution companyEsperanto Filmoj(Esperanto Films, named because of his support for the international languageEsperantoInterviewbySam Greenwith Cuarn.), which has credits in the filmsDuck Season,Pan's Labyrinth, andGravity (film)Gravity.

Cuarn also directed the controversial public service announcement "I Am Autism" forAutism Speaksthat was sharply criticized by disability rights groups for its negative portrayal of autism.Autistic Community Condemns Autism Speaks

In 2010, Cuarn began to develop the filmGravity (film)Gravity, a drama set in space. He was joined by producerDavid Heyman, with whom Cuarn worked onHarry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban. StarringSandra BullockandGeorge Clooney, the film was released in the fall of 2013Sandra Bullock, George Clooney sci-fi drama 'Gravity' pushed to 2013and opened the70th Venice International Film Festivalin August.Venice Film Festival 2013: Sandra Bullock stuns in a scarlet dress with George Clooney | Mail Online. Dailymail.co.uk. Retrieved on 2014-05-22.The film received tenAcademy Awardnominations, includingAcademy Award for Best PictureBest PictureandAcademy Award for Best DirectingBest Directing. Cuarn won for Best Directing, becoming the first Latin American to win the award, while he andMark Sangershared the award forAcademy Award for Best Film EditingBest Film Editing.

In 2013, Cuarn createdBelieve (TV series)Believe, a science fiction/fantasy/adventure series that is being broadcast as part of the 201314 United States network television schedule on NBC as a mid-season entry. The series was created by Cuarn for Bad Robot Productions and Warner Bros. Television. In 2014,TIMEplaced him in its list of "100 Most Influential People in the World" - Pioneers.cite newsThe 100 Most Influential People - Pioneers: Alfonso CuarónTIME.comhttp://time.com/70897/alfonso-cuaron-2014-time-100/April 23, 20142014-04-26

In May 2015 Cuarn was announced as the President of the Jury for the72nd Venice International Film Festival.cite webhttp://www.labiennale.org/en/cinema/news/11-05.htmlDirector Alfonso Cuarón President of the International Jury for the Venezia 72 Competition11 May 201511 May 2015Venice Biennale
article.heading: Personal life
article.paragraph: Cuarn is a vegetariancite webhttps://www.loquetlondon.com/blog/sheherazade-goldsmith-vogue/Vogue Arts - Down to EarthLoquet London26 July 2015and has been living inLondonsince 2000.Baftas 2014: Alfonso Cuarn wins best director for Gravity | Film. theguardian.com. Retrieved on 2014-05-22.He was 20 when his girlfriend at the time became pregnant withJons CuarnJons.cite webhttp://www.vulture.com/2013/09/director-alfonso-cuaron-on-making-gravity.htmlThe Camera's Cusp: Alfonso Cuarón Takes Filmmaking to a New Extreme With Gravity''Vulture''22 September 201312 July 2015He was married toItalyItalianactress and freelance journalist Annalisa Bugliani from 2001 to 2008. They have two children: daughter Tess Bu Cuarn (born 2003) and son Olmo Teodoro Cuarn (born 2005). Since 2010, he has been in a relationship with jeweller and writerSheherazade Goldsmith.cite webhttp://www.standard.co.uk/lifestyle/london-life/gravity-director-alfonso-cuarn-yes-you-can-have-sex-in-outer-space-9133435.htmlGravity director Alfonso Cuarón: Yes, you can have sex in outer space''London Evening Standard''17 February 201412 July 2015cite webhttps://www.net-a-porter.com/magazine/236/17The Interview: Sheherazade GoldsmithNet-a-Porter201412 July 2015
